org.threadly.litesockets

Class UDPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.Server
      • org.threadly.litesockets.UDPServer

  • public class UDPServer
extends Server
    A Simple UDP Server. This is a UDP socket implementation for litesockets. This UDPServer is treated like a TCPServer. It will notify the ClientAcceptor any time a new unique ip:port send a packet to this UDP socket. The UDPServer does not technically "Accept" new connections it just reads data from the socket and that data also has the host/port of where it came from. You can also just create a UDPClient from a server to initiate a connection to another UDP server, if that server sends data back from that same port/ip pair it will show up as a read in the created client.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from class: Server
        Tells the Server to stop accepting connections. The Listen port is still open and you can call Server.start() to start listening again. Use Server.close() to close the Listen port.
        Overrides:
        stop in class Server

      • setFilterMode

        public void setFilterMode(UDPServer.UDPFilterMode fm)
        Sets the UDPfilterMode for the server. This allows us to white or black list IP/ports from being accepted. NOTE: calling set on this also resets any hosts currently already in the filter!
        Parameters:
        fm - the UDPFilterMode to use.

      • filterHost

        public void filterHost(java.net.InetSocketAddress isa)
        Adds a host to the filter. How this filter will apply depends on what the UDPFilterMode is set to in the UDPServer. A port number of 0 means we block/accept all ports for that host.
        Parameters:
        isa - the InetSocketAddress to use for the filter.

      • setFrameSize

        public void setFrameSize(int size)
        Sets the frame size for this UDPServer. This will also set it on all clients that are spawned from this server.
        Parameters:
        size - the frame size in bytes.

      • getFrameSize

        public int getFrameSize()
        Gets the frame size for this UDPServer.
        Returns:
        the max allowed UDP frame size.

      • acceptChannel

        public void acceptChannel(java.nio.channels.SelectableChannel c)
        Description copied from class: Server

        This is how the extending server receives the SelectableChannel. At this point it needs to do what is needed to turn this Channel into A Client object for this type of server.

        Parameters:
        c - The SelectableChannel that was just accepted by this Server.

      • getServerType

        public WireProtocol getServerType()
        Description copied from class: Server

        This is used by the SocketExecuter to know how to handle this Server when its added to it. Currently only UDP or TCP.

        Specified by:
        getServerType in class Server
        Returns:
        returns the type of protocol this socket uses.

      • setClientAcceptor

        public void setClientAcceptor(Server.ClientAcceptor clientAcceptor)
        Description copied from class: Server

        Set the Server.ClientAcceptor for this Server. This should be set before the Server is added to the SocketExecuter. If its not you could miss pending client connections.

        Overrides:
        setClientAcceptor in class Server
        Parameters:
        clientAcceptor - Sets the Server.ClientAcceptor callback for this server.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: Server

        Close this servers Socket. Once closed you must construct a new Server to open it again.

        Specified by:
        close in class Server

      • write

        public org.threadly.concurrent.future.ListenableFuture<?> write(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb,
                                                                java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteAddress)
        Allows you to write to the UDPServer directly without a UDPClient.
        Parameters:
        bb - The ByteBuffer to write.
        remoteAddress - the remote host/port to write too.
        Returns:
        a ListenableFuture that will be completed once the ByteBuffer for this write is put on the socket.

      • setUDPReader

        public void setUDPReader(UDPServer.UDPReader udpReader)
        Sets a UDPServer.UDPReader for this server. This can be used to intercept reads before they create/call on a UDPClient. Set to null to remove it.
        Parameters:
        udpReader - the UDPServer.UDPReader to use for this UDPServer.

      • createUDPClient

        public UDPClient createUDPClient(java.lang.String host,
                                 int port)
        Creates a new client from this UDPServer. If a client is already created for that source address that client will be returned.
        Parameters:
        host - the remote host to send data to.
        port - the port on that host to send data to.
        Returns:
        a UDPClient pointing to that remote address.
